verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Opening of a new speech section in Leviticus.

verses.text: Speak to the people of Israel, saying, ‘If anyone sins unintentionally in any of the commandments of the LORD concerning things not to be done, and does any one of them,
verses.comment: The phrase 'sins unintentionally' covers sins done in ignorance or by mistake.

verses.text: if the anointed priest sins, bringing guilt upon the people, then he must offer to the LORD, for the sin that he has committed, a young bull without defect as a sin offering.
verses.comment: 'Anointed priest' refers to the high priest. 'Sin offering' is from Hebrew 'chattat.'

verses.text: He will bring the bull to the entrance of the tent of meeting before the LORD, and lay his hand on the bull's head and kill the bull before the LORD.
verses.comment: 'Laying his hand' symbolizes identification with the sacrifice.

verses.text: The anointed priest will take some of the bull’s blood and bring it into the tent of meeting.
verses.comment: Blood is used for ritual purification.

verses.text: The priest will dip his finger in the blood and sprinkle some of the blood seven times before the LORD in front of the veil of the sanctuary.
verses.comment: Seven-fold sprinkling indicates completeness.

verses.text: The priest will put some of the blood on the horns of the altar of fragrant incense before the LORD which is in the tent of meeting, and all the rest of the blood of the bull he will pour out at the base of the altar of burnt offering, which is at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
verses.comment: Blood on altar horns symbolizes purification of sanctuary space.

verses.text: He will remove all the fat of the bull of the sin offering—the fat that covers the entrails and all the fat that is on the entrails,
verses.comment: Fat reserved for the LORD—see earlier sacrificial procedures.

verses.text: and the two kidneys with the fat that is on them at the loins, and the long lobe of the liver, which he will remove with the kidneys—
verses.comment: 'Long lobe' refers to the 'caudate lobe' in Hebrew.

verses.text: just as these are removed from the ox of the sacrifice of the peace offering—and the priest will burn them on the altar of burnt offering.
verses.comment: Peace offering procedure referenced.

verses.text: But the hide of the bull and all its flesh, along with its head, legs, entrails, and internal organs—
verses.comment: Whole animal (minus fat portions) is disposed outside the camp.

verses.text: the whole bull—he will carry outside the camp to a clean place, to the ash heap, and burn it up on a wood fire; it will be burned on the ash heap.
verses.comment: Sin offering remnants disposed outside camp to signify removal of sin.

verses.text: If the whole congregation of Israel sins unintentionally, and the thing is hidden from the eyes of the assembly, and they do any one of the things that the LORD has commanded should not be done, and become guilty,
verses.comment: 'Unintentional sin' also applies corporately.

verses.text: when the sin which they have committed becomes known, the assembly will bring a young bull as a sin offering and bring it before the tent of meeting.
verses.comment: Same procedure as for anointed priest.

verses.text: The elders of the congregation will lay their hands on the head of the bull before the LORD, and the bull will be killed before the LORD.
verses.comment: Elders represent the congregation.

verses.text: Then the anointed priest will bring some of the bull’s blood into the tent of meeting,
verses.comment: Carrying blood into sanctuary repeats priestly procedure.

verses.text: The priest will dip his finger in the blood and sprinkle it seven times before the LORD in front of the veil.
verses.comment: Parallel to earlier sin offering steps.

verses.text: He will put some of the blood on the horns of the altar that is before the LORD in the tent of meeting, and pour out all the rest of the blood at the base of the altar of burnt offering at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
verses.comment: Same as vv. 6–7.

verses.text: He will remove all its fat from it and burn it on the altar.
verses.comment: Fat burning as in other offerings.

verses.text: He will do with the bull just as he did with the sin offering bull; so will he do with this. And the priest will make atonement for them, and they will be forgiven.
verses.comment: 'Atonement' (Hebrew kipper) means covering/cleansing sin.

verses.text: He will bring the bull outside the camp and burn it, as he burned the first bull. It is the sin offering for the assembly.
verses.comment: Repetition for clarity.

verses.text: When a leader sins, doing unintentionally any one of all the things that the LORD his God has commanded not to be done, and becomes guilty,
verses.comment: 'Leader' (Hebrew 'nasí') refers to a tribal or civil chief.

verses.text: if his sin which he has committed is made known to him, he must bring as his offering a male goat without defect.
verses.comment: Male goat specifies a different animal for leaders.

verses.text: He will lay his hand on the head of the goat and kill it at the place where they kill the burnt offering before the LORD. It is a sin offering.
verses.comment: Continuous use of hand-laying and sacrifice at burnt offering site.

verses.text: The priest will take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and pour out its blood at the base of the altar of burnt offering.
verses.comment: Note: This is the outdoor altar, not the incense altar (difference from high priest/assembly offering).

verses.text: He will burn all its fat on the altar, like the fat of the sacrifice of peace offerings. So the priest will make atonement for him for his sin, and he will be forgiven.
verses.comment: Sin is forgiven after atonement.

verses.text: If any of the common people sins unintentionally by doing any one of the things the LORD has commanded not to be done and becomes guilty,
verses.comment: ‘Common people’ refers to lay Israelites, non-leaders.

verses.text: if his sin which he has committed is made known to him, he must bring for his offering a female goat without defect for the sin which he has committed.
verses.comment: Gender and species of offering differ for the common person.

verses.text: He will lay his hand on the head of the sin offering and kill the sin offering at the place of burnt offering.
verses.comment: Same hand-laying and location as for other groups.

verses.text: The priest will take some of its blood with his finger and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and pour out all the rest of its blood at the base of the altar.
verses.comment: Same ritual for laypersons as for leaders.

verses.text: He will remove all its fat, just as the fat is removed from the peace offerings, and the priest will burn it on the altar for a pleasing aroma to the LORD. So the priest will make atonement for him, and he will be forgiven.
verses.comment: 'Pleasing aroma' is a standard worship phrase.

verses.text: If he brings a lamb as his offering for a sin offering, he will bring a female without defect.
verses.comment: Lamb is an alternative to goat for common people.

verses.text: He will lay his hand on the head of the sin offering and kill it as a sin offering in the place where they kill the burnt offerings.
verses.comment: Details repeat earlier sin offering procedure.

verses.text: The priest will take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and pour out all the rest of its blood at the base of the altar.
verses.comment: For lambs, same as for goat; blood applied to altar.

verses.text: He will remove all its fat, just as the fat of the lamb is removed from the peace offering, and the priest will burn it on the altar with the offerings made by fire to the LORD. So the priest will make atonement for him for the sin he has committed, and he will be forgiven.
verses.comment: Closing statement emphasizes the result: forgiveness after atonement and sacrifice.
